gurmukhi: ਅਪਨੇ ਮਾਸਹਿ ਕਾਟਿ ਕੈ ਅਾਗ ਮੈ ਹੋਮ ਕਰਯੋ ਨ ਰਤੀ ਕੁ ਡਰਾਯੋ || ਹਾਥ ਧਰੋ ਜਿਹ ਕੇ ਸਿਰ ਪੈ ਤਿਹ ਛਾਰ ੳੁਡੈ ਸੁ ੲਿਹੈ ਬਰੁ ਪਾਯੋ ||੨੪੫੭||
transliteration: Apne Maasah(i) Kaattee Kai Aag Mai Hom Daryo Na Ratiku Daraayo|| Haath Ddaro Jih Ke Sir Pai Tih Chhaad Udai Su Ihai Bar(u) Paayo||2457||
translation: He without any fear, cut down his flesh and performed homa in fire, he was bestowed this boon that on the head of whomsoever he would place his hand, he would be reduced to ashes.2457.

gurmukhi: ਹਾਥ ਧਰੋ ਜਿਹ ਕੈ ਸਿਰ ਪੈ ਤਿਹ ਛਾਰ ੳੁਡੈ ਜਬ ਹੀ ਬਰੁ ਪਾਯੋ || ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਹੀ ਕੳੁ ਪ੍ਰਥਮੈ ਹਤਿ ਕੈ ਜੜ ਚਾਹਤ ਤੳੁ ਤਿਹ ਤ੍ਰੀਅ ਛਿਨਾਯੋ ||
transliteration: Haath Ddaro Jih Kai Sir Pai Tih Chhaad Udai Job Hibar(u) Paayo|| Rudra Hikau Prathmai Hat(i) Kai Jad Chahat Tau Tih Treeaa Chhinaayo||
translation: When he obtained the boon of placing his hand and reducing the person to ashes, then that fool in the first place wanted to reduce Rudra to ashes and seize Parvati;

gurmukhi: ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਭਜਯੋ ਤਬ ਅਾੲਿ ਹੈ ਸਯਾਮ ਜੂ ਅਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਸੋ ਛਲ ਸੋ ਜਰਵਾਯੋ || ਭੂਪ ਕਹੋ ਬਡੋ ਸੋ ਤੁਮ ਹੀ ਕਿ ਬਡੋ ਹਰਿ ਹੈ ਜਿਹ ਤਾਹਿ ਬਚਾਯੋ ||੨੪੫੮||
transliteration: Rudra Bhajyo Tab Aae Hai Syaam Joo Aae Kai So Chhal So Jarvaayo|| Bhoop Kaho Bado So Toum Hiki Bado Har(i) Hai Jih Taah(i) Bachadyo||2458||
translation: Then Rudra ran and with deception, he caused the reduction of Bhumasura; therefore O king! you may tell me now whether you are great or God is great, who protected you.2458.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕ ਗ੍ਰੰਥੇ ਕ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਨਾਵਤਾਰੇ ਭਸਮਾਂਗਤ ਦੈਤ ਬਧਹ ||
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Krishnaavatdare Bhasmaanad Dait Badhah||
translation: End of the description of the killing of the demon Bhasmangad in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: ਅਥ ਭ੍ਰਿਗ ਲਤਾ ਕੋ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਗ ਕਥਨੰ ||
transliteration: Ath Bhrig Lataa Ko Prasan Krishnaavatdare Bhasmaanad Dait Badhah||
translation: Now begins the description of the striking of leg by Bhrigu

gurmukhi: ਬੈਠੇ ਹੁਤੇ ਰਿਖ ਸਾਤ ਤਹਾਂ ੲਿਕਠੇ ਤਿਮ ਕੇ ਜੀਅ ਮੈ ਅਸ ਅਾਯੋ || ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਭਲੋ ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਕਿਧੋ ਬਿਸ਼ਨ ਜੂ ਪੈ ਪ੍ਰਿਥਮੈ ਜਿਹ ਕੋ ਠਹਰਾਯੋ ||
transliteration: Baithe Houte Rikh Saat Tahaan Ikathe Tim Ke Jeeaa Mai As Aayo|| Rudra Bhalo Brahmaa Kidho Bishan Joo Pai Pritmai Jih Ko Thahraayo||
translation: Once the seven sages sat together, thought in their mind that Rudra was good, Brahma was good and Vishnu was the best of all;

gurmukhi: ਤੀਨੋ ਅਨੰਤ ਹੈ ਅੰਤਿ ਕਛੂ ਨਹਿ ਹੈ ੲਿਨ ਕੋ ਕਿਨਹੂੰ ਨਹੀ ਪਾਯੋ || ਭੇਦ ਲਹੋ ੲਿਨ ਕੋ ਤਿਨ ਮੈ ਭ੍ਰਿਗ ਬੈਠੋ ਹੁਤੋ ਸੋੳੂ ਦੇਖਨ ਧਾਯੋ ||੨੪੫੯||
transliteration: Tino Anant Hai Ant(i) Kachhodh Nah(i) Hai In Ko Kinhoon Nahipaayo|| Bhed Laho In Ko Tin Mai Bhrig Baitho Houto Sooo Dekhan Dhaayo||2459||
translation: The play of all the three is infinite; none had been able to understand their mystery; in order to understand their tone, Bhrigu, one of the sages sitting there, went away,2459.

gurmukhi: ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਕੇ ਧਾਮ ਗਯੋ ਕਹਿਓ ਤੁਮ ਜੀਵ ਹਨੋ ਤਿਹ ਸੂਲ ਸੰਭਾਰਯੋ || ਗਯੋ ਚਤੁਰਾਨਨ ਕੇ ਚਲਿ ਕੈ ੲਿਹ ਬੇਦ ਰਰੈ ੲਿਹ ਜਾਨਨ ਪਾਰਯੋ ||
transliteration: Rudra Ke Dhaam Gado Kahio Toum Jeev Hano Tih Sool Sanbdaryo|| Gyo Chaturaanan Ke Chal(i) Kai Eh Bed Darai Eh Jaanan Pdaryo||
translation: He went to the house of Rudra; the sage said to Rudra, “You destroy the beings;” hearing this Rudra took up his trident; then that sage went to Brahma and said, “You repeat the reading of Vedas uselessly;” Brahma also did not like these words;

gurmukhi: ਬਿਸ਼ਨ ਕੇ ਲੋਕ ਗਯੋ ਸੁਖ ਸੋਵਤ ਕੋਪ ਭਰਯੋ ਰਿਖ ਲਾਤਹਿ ਮਾਰਯੋ || ਕੋਪ ਕੀਯੋ ਨ ਗਹੇ ਰਿਖ ਪਾ ੲਿਹਿ ਸ੍ਰੀਪਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬ੍ਰਿਜਨਾਥ ਬਿਚਾਰਯੋ ||੨੪੬੦||
transliteration: Bishan Ke Lok Gado Soukh Sovat Kop Bhdaryo Rikh Paa Eh(i) Sripat(i) Sribrijnaath Bichdaryo||2460||
translation: When he reached near Vishnu and seeing him sleeping the sage struck him with his leg; Vishnu did not become angry and catching his feet, he said thus to him;2460.
Speech of Vishnu addressed to Bhrigu:
